Original recommendation: (a) Indicate the study’s design with a commonly used term in the title or the abstract
Adapted question (words in square bracke: Indicate the study’s design [as cross-sectional, cohort or case-control] in the title or the abstract

Adapted question (words in square bracke: Provide in the abstract an informative and balanced summary of what was done
Provide in the abstract an informative and balanced summary of what was found

Original recommendation: Explain the scientific background and rationale for the investigation being reported

Original recommendation: State specific objectives, including any prespecified hypotheses
Present key elements of study design early in the paper
Describe the setting, locations, and relevant dates, including periods of recruitment, exposure, follow-up, and data collection

Describe the locations
Describe the relevant dates, including periods of recruitment
Describe the relevant dates, including periods of exposure

Original recommendation: (a) Cohort study—Give the eligibility criteria, and the sources and methods of selection of participants. Describe methods of follow-up. Case-control study—Give the eligibility criteria, and the sources and methods of case ascertainment and control selection. Give the rationale for the choice of cases and controls. Cross-sectional study—Give the eligibility criteria, and the sources and methods of selection of participants
Adapted question (words in square bracke: [Cohort and cross-sectional studies] – Give the eligibility criteria
[Cohort and cross-sectional studies] – Give the sources of participants.
[Cohort and cross-sectional studies] – Give the methods of selection of participants
Cohort study - Describe methods of follow-up
Case-control study - Give the eligibility criteria
Case-control study – Give the sources of case ascertainment and control selection
Case-control study – Give the methods of case ascertainment and control selection.
Case-control study – Give the rationale for the choice of cases and controls

Original recommendation: (b) Cohort study—For matched studies, give matching criteria and number of exposed and unexposed. Case-control study—For matched studies, give matching criteria and the number of controls per case
Adapted question (words in square bracke: Cohort study - For matched studies, give matching criteria
Cohort study - For matched studies, give number of exposed and unexposed
Case-control study - For matched studies, give matching criteria
Case-control study - For matched studies, give the number of controls per case
